steps: Add amaranth to a cooking pot. Cover amaranth with double the amount of water and season for taste.
Bring water to a boil then lower heat to low. Cover the pot with a lid and simmer until it has completely absorbed the water ~ 15 minutes.
Transfer cooked amaranth to a plate.
Add yogurt.
Add peeled and sliced kiwifruit.
Top with almonds and sprinkle with nutmeg (if using).
Add amaranth to a cooking pot. Cover amaranth with double the amount of water and season for taste.
Bring water to a boil then lower heat to low. Cover the pot with a lid and simmer until it has completely absorbed the water ~ 15 minutes.
Transfer cooked amaranth to a plate.
Add peeled and diced pear.
Mix yogurt with cocoa (if using) and add it to the plate. Sprinkle with cocoa.
Add amaranth to a cooking pot. Cover amaranth with double the amount of water and season for taste.
Bring water to a boil then lower heat to low. Cover the pot with a lid and simmer until it has completely absorbed the water ~ 15 minutes.
Transfer cooked amaranth to a plate.
Add yogurt.
Top with sliced strawberries.
Add hemp hearts (if using).
Wash oranges and apples. Peel the oranges and cut all the fruit into bite-sized pieces. Reserve some of the orange.
Squeeze the reserved orange over the fruit and mix everything together.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and garnish with chopped hazelnuts (if using).
Toast the bread.
Spread the peanut butter over the toast.
Slice the apple and arrange the slices on top of the toast.
Sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Add mushrooms and ½ cup of water to a frying pan. Bring to a boil and cook on high heat until all the water has evaporated.
Reduce heat to medium. Season for taste and stir continuously until the mushrooms become golden brown.
Toast the bread.
Cut, de-stone and peel the avocado. Mash it with a fork and spread on the toast.
Add cooked mushrooms.
Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds (if using).
Toast the bread.
Cut, de-stone and peel the avocado. Mash it with a fork and spread on the toast.
Add sliced tomatoes.
Top with parsley and pine nuts (if using). Drizzle with balsamic vinegar (if using).
Toast tortilla in the oven for 2 minutes.
Spread peanut butter over the tortilla.
Add ripe banana and sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Roll it up.
Cut into two or into bite-sized rolls and sprinkle with cinnamon again (if using).
Toast the bread.
Mash the banana with a fork and spread it over the toast.
Add walnuts (if using).
Sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Toast the bread.
Cut, de-stone and peel the avocado. Mash it with a fork and spread on the toast.
Drain and add black beans. Season for taste.
Garnish with parsley and hemp hearts (if using).
Combine all of the ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Mash everything together with a potato masher, a spoon or a hand blender.
Transfer the batter to a baking dish lined with baking paper and spread it with a spoon.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and bake the brownies in the middle of the oven for 40 minutes.
Let them rest for 30 minutes outside of the oven before cutting.
Drain the chickpeas and transfer to a bowl. Add garlic (if using), tahini and ½ cup of water.
Season for taste and mash chickpeas and tahini together with a fork until combined.
Toast the bread and spread chickpea paste over a slice of bread.
Use a potato peeler to cut cucumber into ribbons and place on top of the toast.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds (if using).
Add butter to a frying pan. Heat it up and add rolled oats.
Add any dried berries or dried fruit of your choice, nuts and seeds (if using).
Toast the oats for 5 minutes or until they begin to turn golden brown.
Transfer plain yogurt to a bowl.
Top with toasted oats.
Cover oat flakes with double the amount of water.
Bring to a boil and stir for 3 minutes until it thickens.
Transfer cooked oatmeal to a plate.
Add diced apple.
Add raisins and sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg (if using).
Cover oat flakes with double the amount of water.
Bring to a boil and stir for 3 minutes or until it thickens.
Transfer cooked oatmeal to a plate.
Add banana sliced lengthwise.
Add walnuts and sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Combine oat flakes and water 1:1 ratio in a cooking pot. Add maple syrup (if using) and mix well.
Transfer to a cooking plate and bring to a boil. Stir for 2 minutes until the oatmeal mix thickens.
Split the mix into two halves. Transfer one half to a baking tray lined with baking paper.
Mix the other half with blueberries and spread it over the base.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Sprinkle with powdered clove and top with crushed walnuts (if using).
Add oat flakes and cocoa powder to a cooking pot. Cover with double the amount of water and mix.
Bring to a boil and stir for 3 minutes or until it thickens.
Transfer cooked oatmeal to a plate.
Top with coconut flakes.
Add water, maple syrup and peanut butter to a large saucepan. Whisk together until combined.
Add oat flakes and mix until combined.
Transfer the mix to a countertop lined with baking paper. Cover with another sheet and press down.
Wrap it up and place into the fridge to chill overnight or for at least 4 hours.
Cut into bars.
Rinse quinoa really well until the water runs clear.
Transfer to a cooking pot. Cover with double the amount of water and bring to a boil.
Lower heat to low, cover with a lid. Cook for ~15 minutes until tender.
Transfer cooked quinoa to a plate.
Add sliced apple.
Combine peanut butter with water 1:3 ratio and stir until creamy. Drizzle over the quinoa.
Sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Rinse quinoa really well.
Transfer to a cooking pot. Cover with double the amount of water and cook for ~15 minutes.
Peel and dice the apples. Add to a saucepan with ½ cup water and spices.
Cook apples for 10 minutes or until water evaporates.
Transfer cooked quinoa to a plate.
Top with spiced apples.
Rinse quinoa until water runs clear.
Cook quinoa with double the amount of water for ~15 minutes.
Transfer cooked quinoa to a plate.
Add yogurt.
Add sliced orange.
Add walnuts and sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Peel and cut sweet potato. Boil for 15 minutes or until soft.
Drain potatoes. Add milk, flour and baking powder (if using). Mix until smooth.
Spoon portions onto a baking tray lined with baking paper.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Bake for 10 minutes, flip, bake another 10 minutes.
Garnish with yogurt, fresh basil and raisins (if using). Sprinkle with nutmeg (if using).
Toast the bread.
Season for taste and mash the beans. Spread them on top of the toast.
Add sliced tomatoes.
Top with parsley and pine nuts (if using). Drizzle with balsamic vinegar (if using).
Toast tortilla in the oven for 2 minutes.
Mash avocado and spread on the tortilla.
Drain and add chickpeas. Season for taste.
Garnish with red onion and sesame seeds (if using). Fold it up.
Peel and dice butternut squash. Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes.
Cut tortilla into strips and arrange on squash.
Mix tomato sauce and molasses. Combine with drained beans.
Add beans to squash and tortilla strips. Bake for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley.
Rinse rice well. Cook with double the amount of water (~20 minutes for white rice).
Add cooked rice and drained beans to a plate. Season and mix.
Garnish with parsley, spring onions and sprinkle with cumin (if using).
Rinse and cook rice (~20 minutes).
Add cooked rice and drained beans to a plate. Add sweet corn.
Add sliced avocado and season for taste.
Add salsa, top with parsley and sprinkle with cayenne pepper (if using).
Peel sweet potato, cut in half and bake at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes.
Make a well in the middle of the potato.
Add cooked beans and season for taste.
Top with tahini thinned with water and parsley (if using). Sprinkle with cumin (if using).
Toast tortilla in the oven for 2 minutes.
Drain the beans. Fill tortilla with beans and mash them.
Mix yogurt with cumin and garlic powder (if using) and spread over beans.
Add diced cucumber, season for taste and fold into a roll.
Garnish with parsley (if using).
Clean mushrooms and coat in balsamic vinegar. Arrange on baking tray.
Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes until browning.
Flip mushrooms, add broccoli florets (can use frozen). Drizzle with soy sauce (if using).
Roast for another 10 minutes.
Transfer to plate. Sprinkle with sesame seeds (if using).
Cut broccoli into florets. Peel carrot and de-seed bell pepper. Cut both into pieces.
Blanch vegetables in boiling water (carrots 7 min, broccoli 5 min, bell pepper 2 min).
Drain and run under cold water.
Add garlic (if using) and sesame oil to frying pan. Set heat to high.
Add blanched vegetables and stir fry for 2 minutes. Season for taste.
Transfer to plate. Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds (if using).
Rinse and cook rice (~20 minutes for white rice).
Finely dice onion and tomato. Saute with ½ cup water until water evaporates.
Combine milk, molasses and curry powder. Add to tomatoes with drained chickpeas. Cook 3-4 minutes.
Transfer rice to plate. Add chickpea curry.
Garnish with fresh parsley (if using).
Drain chickpeas. Add garlic (if using), tahini and ½ cup water. Mash until combined.
Toast tortilla in oven for 2 minutes. Spread chickpea tahini paste.
Add chopped lettuce, fold into roll.
Sprinkle with cayenne pepper (if using).
Cut eggplant and green beans into pieces. Arrange on baking tray.
Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 15 minutes until browning.
Transfer to plate and season for taste.
Add cut orange. Squeeze some orange juice over.
Add crumbled white cheese. Top with pine nuts and sprinkle with black pepper (if using).
Cut eggplant into thin slices lengthwise. Arrange on baking tray.
Combine tomato sauce, molasses and smoked paprika (add liquid smoke if using). Coat eggplant.
Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes until browning.
Toast the bread.
Add cut lettuce.
Add cooked eggplant slices.
Top with sesame seeds (if using).
Dice eggplant, zucchini and onion. Arrange on baking tray. Season.
Sprinkle with cinnamon (if using) and cover with tomato sauce mixed with molasses.
Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes until browning.
Transfer to plate.
Garnish with fresh basil and sesame seeds (if using).
Dice onion and green bell pepper.
Combine all ingredients in large pot. Season for taste.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley (if using).
Rinse and cook rice (~20 minutes).
Add chickpeas and rice to plate. Season and mix.
Squeeze lemon into cup. Add tahini to lemon juice and mix until creamy.
Drizzle over chickpeas and rice.
Garnish with parsley, lemon slices and sesame seeds (if using).

Combine cooked lentils with oat flakes, tomato sauce and molasses. Season.
Shape into rectangle on baking tray. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes.
Top with remaining sauce. Bake 2 more minutes.
Cut into pieces. Garnish with parsley (if using).
Separate cauliflower into florets. Boil for 15 minutes until tender. Drain.
Combine with milk. Season for taste. Mash with fork or blender.
Transfer to plate.
Garnish with spring onions and top with cashews (if using).
Prepare mashed cauliflower as above.
Cut mushrooms, onion into strips and bell pepper into pieces.
Saute with ½ cup water and seasonings (if using) until water evaporates.
Transfer mashed cauliflower to plate.
Top with mushrooms and peppers. Sprinkle with sesame seeds (if using).
Boil pasta according to package instructions. Drain.
Add cleaned and cut mushrooms to pot with 1 cup water. Simmer 20 minutes.
Mix milk with flour and add to mushrooms. Simmer 2 minutes until cream thickens.
Add cooked pasta. Stir to combine.
Transfer to plate. Garnish with spring onions (if using).
Boil pasta according to package instructions. Drain.
Transfer to plate.

Drain pasta with zucchini and peas. Transfer to plate.

Drizzle with tahini thinned with water.
Top with spring onions and hemp hearts (if using).

Dice mushrooms and onion. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20 minutes.
Mix milk with flour and add to mushrooms. Simmer 2 minutes until cream thickens.
Add rice and cream mushrooms to plate.
Top with fresh parsley and sprinkle with black pepper (if using).

Combine peas and corn in saucepan with ½ cup water. Boil then drain.
Add rice to plate.

Slice zucchini and onion. Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes.
Add cooked rice and roasted vegetables to plate. Season for taste.

Peel and dice butternut squash. Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes until tender.

Garnish with spring onions and pumpkin seeds (if using).
Boil spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain.
Combine diced tomato, eggplant, molasses, cinnamon (if using) and 1 cup water.
Simmer for 30 minutes until water is almost gone.
Add cooked spaghetti to sauce and mix until coated.
Transfer to plate.

Rinse rice and spinach. Cook together with double the amount of water (~20 minutes).
Transfer to plate.
Add chopped sun-dried tomatoes and drizzle with lemon juice (if using).
Add extra lemon slices for garnish and sprinkle with sesame seeds (if using).

Add seaweed flakes and mix well.
Use potato peeler to cut cucumber and peeled carrot into strips. Arrange on rice.
Drizzle with rice vinegar, sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Add umeboshi paste if using.
Rinse and cook rice (~20 minutes). Combine with vinegar.
Quarter cucumber lengthwise, remove seeds, slice into thin strips.
Cut avocado into slices directly from shell.
Place rice on nori sheet, leaving ½ inch at top. Flatten rice.
Place cucumber and avocado strips on rice towards bottom.
Roll up tightly using mat. Cut into pieces.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with soy sauce.

Clean and cut bell peppers into bite-sized pieces.
Combine vinegar, maple syrup, flour and water. Pour over peppers.
Cook for 10 minutes until sauce thickens and reduces.
Add rice, cook and stir for 2 more minutes. Season.
Transfer to plate. Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds.

Transfer to plate.

Drizzle with tahini thinned with water.

Combine milk, curry powder and tomato paste. Pour over potatoes.
Add spinach (can use frozen). Cook 2-3 minutes until curry thickens.
Add rice to one side of plate and curry to the other.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Thin miso paste with water if using and drizzle over potatoes.

Mix water, tomato sauce and molasses. Pour over cabbage. Simmer 10 minutes.

Fill each tortilla with beans.

Cook for 10 minutes until lentils are tender.
Add milk, molasses and curry powder. Cook 2-3 minutes until thickened.
Add rice to one side of plate and lentil curry to the other.
Top with spring onions and cashew nuts.
Cut zucchini into bite-sized pieces. Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes.
Transfer to plate.
Mix yogurt, dill and garlic to make sauce. Season for taste.
Place sauce alongside zucchini.
Garnish zucchini with spring onions and sprinkle with black pepper.
Heat the oil over medium heat until it sizzles, then add the garlic and chicken.
Add all the vegetable and sauce, mix everything together, and then add the glass noodles. Allow the mixture to cool down before rolling.
Take a spring roll sheet and place it with the smooth side facing down, and one corner pointing towards you.
Place the filling in one corner, closest to you.
Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper up and over the filling, pressing firmly. Continue rolling towards the center of the wrapper.
Fold both the left and right corners inwards, resembling an envelope. Brush the top edge with beaten egg, then roll up tightly.
Deep fry the spring rolls until golden brown. Serve with sweet chili sauce and plum sauce.
Chop garlic and shallot together, then add them to the same group as pickled radish, tofu and dried shrimp (Group 1).
Cut large chunks of garlic chives and group them together with carrot and bean sprouts.
Heat cooking oil over medium heat, then add (Group 1). Add chicken and cook until done. Crack the egg and allow it to cook before scrambling.

Push everything to one side of the wok, then add noodles and some water. Stir for a minute, then add sauce. Ensure all the ingredients are coated with the sauce, and then add the remaining vegetables (bean sprouts, shredded carrot, and garlic chives).
Serve with chili flakes, ground peanuts, lime, chives, and bean sprouts.

ingredients: Dried spru chili 2 (cut in big chunks)
Spring onion 1 stem (cut in big chunks)
steps: Heat the wok over medium heat, then add cooking oil.
Once the oil is hot, add garlic and dried chili.
Add chicken and cook it thoroughly. When the chicken is cooked, add the carrot, onion, and bell peppers. Pour water into the wok to cook the vegetables.
Add the sauce and mix everything together, ensuring all the ingredients are coated. Add spring onion and cashew nuts, and stir.
Serve with rice.
Chop the garlic and chilies together.
Fry the hot basil until it's crispy, then remove it from the wok. Using the same oil, fry an egg over medium heat until the edges are crispy. Remove from the wok and keep it warm.
In the same wok, add cooking oil and heat it to medium temperature. Add the chopped garlic and chilies, and cook until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook it thoroughly. Then, add all the sauce and stir until well mixed.
Add the hot basil and spur chili, then cook for around 10 seconds. Turn off the heat.
Serve with rice, crispy basil and the fried crispy egg.
Heat oil in the wok over medium heat.
Once the oil is sizzling, add garlic and chicken.
Cook the chicken until done, then push it to one side of the wok and crack in the egg. Scramble the egg and then add onions, bell peppers, and a small amount of water.
Mix in the sauce thoroughly.
Add spur chili, Chinese celery and spring onions. Cook for a short time.
Serve with rice.

ingredients: Kaffir lime leaf (take the stem off)
steps: Place cumin, coriander seeds, and black pepper in a pan without oil over medium heat. Roast them until you smell their fragrance.
Cut all the fresh ingredients into small pieces to make them easier to pound.
In a mortar, pound the roasted spices and fresh ingredients together. Then, add salt and shrimp paste.
Continue pounding with green chilies and sweet basil leaves. Mix everything together until it forms a smooth paste.
Heat 1/2 spatula of cooking oil in a pan and add the curry paste. Stir and cook until the fragrance comes through. Then, add the chicken pieces.
Pour in half of the coconut milk and cook the chicken until it is done. Then, add the remainder of the coconut milk. Add a small amount of water and stir.
Add the eggplants and kaffir lime leaf. Season with fish sauce and coconut sugar. Wait until the eggplants are cooked through.
Finally, add the spru chili and sweet basil, and serve.
To roast the coriander seeds, place them in a pan without oil over medium heat. Roast them until you smell the fragrance.
Chop all the fresh ingredients into small pieces to make them easier to pound.
In a mortar, pound the roasted coriander seeds and fresh ingredients together. Add salt and shrimp paste, and continue pounding.
Add the blended red chili and continue pounding until everything forms a paste.
Heat 1/2 spatula of cooking oil in a pan and add the curry paste. Stir and cook until the fragrance comes through. Then, add the chicken pieces.
Pour in half of the coconut milk and cook the chicken until it is done. Then, add the remainder of the coconut milk. Add a small amount of water and stir.
Add the eggplants and kaffir lime leaf. Season with fish sauce and coconut sugar. Wait until the eggplants are cooked through.
Finally, add the spru chili and sweet basil, and serve.
Place coriander seeds, cumin, black pepper, and other whole spices in a pan without oil and roast over medium heat until fragrant.
Chop all fresh ingredients into small pieces.
Pound roasted spices and fresh ingredients together in a mortar. Add salt and shrimp paste, continue pounding.
Add blended dried chili and pound into a paste.
Heat oil in a pan, add curry paste and fry until fragrant. Add chicken and cook.
Add half the coconut milk and cook chicken. Then add the rest of the coconut milk, water, potatoes, onions, star anise, cinnamon, and cashew nuts.
Season with fish sauce, coconut sugar, and tamarind sauce. Simmer until everything is cooked.
Serve with rice.
Place coriander seeds in a pan without oil and roast them over medium heat until you can smell the fragrance.
Chop all the fresh ingredients into small pieces to make them easier to pound.
In a mortar, pound the roasted coriander seeds and fresh ingredients together. Add salt and shrimp paste to the mixture and continue pounding until it forms a paste.
Add blended red chili to the paste and continue pounding until everything is well combined. Mix in the yellow curry powder.
Heat 1/2 spatula of cooking oil in a pan and add the curry paste. Stir and cook until the fragrance comes through. Then, add the chicken pieces.
Pour in half of the coconut milk and cook the chicken until it is done. Then, add the remainder of the coconut milk. Add a small amount of water and stir.

Season the curry with fish sauce and coconut sugar. Add chili oil for coloring. Transfer the curry to a noodle bowl and top it with crispy noodles. Garnish with spring onion and coriander. Serve with pickled mustard green, spicy chili oil, lime and shallots on the side.
Rinse the sticky rice and soak it overnight or for at least 4 hours.
After soaking, drain the rice. If using a metal steamer, line it with white fabric (not needed for bamboo steamers). Place the drained rice in the steamer and cover it with a lid.
If desired, add a pandan leaf to the water in the steamer to infuse the rice with fragrance. Ensure the bamboo steamer does not touch the water.
Steam the rice for about 15-20 minutes, or until it turns from white to translucent.
Heat the coconut milk with Pandan leaves in a wok over medium heat.
Once the coconut milk is warm, add coconut sugar and stir until dissolved.
Add the cooked sticky rice and coat it evenly. Add any desired food coloring, then continue stirring and remove from heat to cool.
To make the salted cream, heat coconut milk over medium heat and add salt.
In a separate bowl, mix corn starch with a small amount of water to create a paste. Add the paste to the salted cream to thicken it.
Serve the rice with mango and crispy mung bean on top.

Transfer drained beans to plate.
Dice tomato and onion and add to beans.
Mix balsamic vinegar with molasses for dressing. Drizzle and mix well.
Top with pine nuts and garnish with parsley.
Heat the oil in the wok over medium heat, then add garlic and tofu.
Add mushrooms and sauce to the wok, and cook until everything is cooked through. Allow the mixture to cool down.
Take one sheet of rice paper and quickly dip it in water to soften.
Lay all the fresh vegetables on the rice paper, then add the filling on top followed by shredded chicken.
Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper up and over the filling, pressing firmly. Continue rolling up.
Cut the rolled rice paper in half, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve with sweet chili sauce and plum sauce.
Heat a pot to medium heat and cook minced chicken with a little water.
Turn off the heat and add fish sauce, chili flakes, lime juice, and sugar to the cooked chicken.
Mix in roasted rice powder and thoroughly combine.
Add the remaining vegetables.
Serve with fresh vegetables.
Crush garlic and chili together in a pestle and mortar, then add peanuts and long beans and lightly mash them.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and coconut sugar to the mixture, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
Add tomatoes, shredded carrot and papaya to the mortar and crush them into the mixture.
Add dried shrimp, then serve with vegetables and sprinkle peanuts on top.
Clean and dice onion. Slice cabbage and grate beetroot.
Add all ingredients to large pot, cover with water.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 30-45 minutes.
Garnish with sesame seeds.
Dice onion. Combine all ingredients in pot. Add cayenne if using.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend some or all of soup if desired.
Garnish with diced avocado and parsley.
Cut bell pepper into strips and broccoli into pieces.
Combine all ingredients except coconut milk in pot.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk and stir. Cook 2 more minutes.
Garnish with sesame seeds.
Cut cabbage into strips, dice tomato, onion and garlic.
Add all ingredients to pot, cover with water.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Rinse lentils. Clean and dice onion.
Add all ingredients to pot, cover with water.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve with dash of balsamic vinegar.
Boil noodles (~4 minutes). Drain.
In separate pot, bring water to boil and add seaweed flakes. Simmer 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, add miso paste and whisk until dissolved.
Transfer to bowl.
Add drained noodles.
Garnish with spring onions and sesame seeds.
Add diced mushrooms, onion and thyme to pot with water. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat, season and stir. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Mix milk with flour and add to mushrooms. Simmer 2 minutes until thickened.
Blend if desired.
Sprinkle with black pepper and garnish with thyme.
Clean and finely dice potatoes and leek.
Add to pot with water and bay leaves if using.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
Remove bay leaves. Garnish with spring onions.
Dice tomato and onion. Add to pot with molasses and water.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add pasta and stir. Cook another 10 minutes.
Garnish with heavy cream and parsley.
Finely dice onion and carrots.
Combine all ingredients in pot. Add rosemary if using.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 30-45 minutes.
Blend some or all of soup if desired.
Garnish with rosemary.
Dice zucchini and onions, peel and grate carrot.
Add all ingredients to pot, cover with water.
Bring to boil, lower heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
Boil lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chili, shallot, and galangal together until you smell the fragrance. (Boil longer if using dry ingredients)
Add mushrooms and onions, then add chili paste, fish sauce and sugar.
Add prawns, but do not stir to prevent a fishy smell.
When the prawns are cooked, turn off the heat and squeeze in lime juice (adding it while boiling can make it bitter).
If you prefer a creamy version, add evaporated milk and chili oil for coloring at the end.
Finally, add finely chopped coriander, sawtooth coriander, and spring onion. Serve and enjoy.
Boil lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, shallot, chili, and galangal together until you can smell the fragrance. If using dry ingredients, extend the boiling time.
Add coconut milk and bring it to a boil. Then, add chicken pieces without stirring.
Once the chicken is cooked through, add mushrooms and onions.
Stir in fish sauce and sugar.
When everything is cooked, turn off the heat and squeeze lime juice. (Adding lime juice while it's boiling can make it bitter.)
Add chili oil for coloring.
Finally, add finely chopped coriander, sawtooth coriander and spring onion.
Boil lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, shallot, chili, and galangal together until the fragrance is noticeable. If using dry ingredients, extend the boiling time.
Add chicken pieces without stirring.
Once the chicken is cooked through, add mushrooms, tomatoes, and onions.
Stir in fish sauce, sugar, chili flakes and rice powder.
Add hot basil and sweet basil, then turn off the heat. Squeeze in lime juice (adding it while boiling can make it bitter).
Finally, add finely chopped coriander, sawtooth coriander, and spring onion. Serve and enjoy.

Crush the lemongrass and cut it into big chunks. Remove the kaffir lime leaves from the stem. Crush the garlic, chili, shallot, turmeric, and 2 slices of galangal. Group all these ingredients together.
Boil the above ingredients together until you can smell the fragrance. If using dry ingredients, extend the boiling time.
Add chicken pieces and cook them through without stirring.
Once the chicken is cooked, add fish sauce, sugar, and tamarind sauce. Stir well and serve.
